page.title: 12THE FLEET POLICE FORCE
page.content: A force of 32 men and 3 women, working a three-shift day, are responsible for {Law and Order}over 40 square miles in and around Fleet.They operate from a Station opened in 1967 on Crookham Road near the town centre.To help them they have 3{patrol cars}(1 Volvo & 2 Escorts) and 1 Transit van for moving prisoners, though most{policemen}ride {bicycles}when on duty. On average, one arrest is made every two weeks, {prisoners}being kept in one of the 4 cells at the Station. The commonest {crimes}are shop-lifting and thefts from cars. At the moment, tracing the origin of forged Â£20 notes is taking up most of their time. Serious crimes, like murder and rape, are rare in Fleet and would be dealt with by Winchester. There is no great drugs problem here. Local support for the police is strong.
